articles.author: Mohammed Salem, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israel called on civilians to evacuate parts of Rafah on Monday in what appeared to be preparation for a long-threatened assault on Hamas holdouts in the southern Gaza Strip city where more than a million war-displaced Palestinians have been sheltering.
articles.title: Israel begins evacuating part of Rafah ahead of threatened assault

articles.author: Joe Brock, Mike Stone
articles.description: The U.S. Navy's efforts to build a fleet of unmanned vessels are faltering because the Pentagon remains wedded to big shipbuilding projects, according to some officials and company executives, exposing a weakness as sea drones reshape naval warfare.
articles.title: Sea drone warfare has arrived. The U.S. is floundering.

articles.author: Jack Queen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Donald Trump returns to a New York courtroom on Monday, where he will be forced to sit silently while others testify about his efforts during the 2016 presidential election to cover up news of an alleged tryst with a porn star.
articles.title: Trump to return to New York courtroom for criminal hush money trial

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: From his office in a distant annexe, French right-wing lawmaker Jean-Paul Garraud has his sights set on a spot much closer to the decision-making heart of the European Parliament.
articles.title: Hard right wants more EU power to reflect likely election gains

articles.author: Emilio Parodi
articles.description: Italy's mafia rarely dirties its hands with blood these days.
articles.title: Italy's white-collar mafia is making a business killing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Monday said it would hold a military exercise that will include practice for the use of tactical nuclear weapons after what the defence ministry said were provocative threats from Western officials.
articles.title: Russia to practice tactical nuclear weapon scenario to deter West - defence ministry

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Steve Holland
articles.description: President Joe Biden will meet Middle East ally, Jordan's King Abdullah II, at the White House on Monday with prospects for a Gaza ceasefire appearing slim and Palestinian Islamist group Hamas and Israeli officials blaming each other for the impasse.
articles.title: Biden meets Jordan's King Abdullah as Gaza ceasefire hopes dim

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping awoke in Paris on Monday on his first visit to the region in five years, with trade and Russia's war with Ukraine on the agenda in talks with France's Emmanuel Macron and European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen.
articles.title: China's Xi in Paris to meet Macron, with trade, Ukraine talks planned

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Monday the Philippines would not use water cannons or any offensive weapons in the South China Sea, and the last thing it wanted was to raise tensions in the strategic waterway.
articles.title: Philippines says won't raise South China Sea tensions, won't use water cannons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 34,735 Palestinians were killed and 78,108 injured in Israel's military offensive on Gaza, the enclave's health ministry said in a statement on Monday.
articles.title: 34,735 Palestinians killed and 78,108 injured in Israel's military offensive on Gaza since Oct.7 - Gaza health ministry
